title: The Importance of Sleep for Teenagers
original:
Teenagers today are often sleep-deprived due to busy school schedules, social activities, and screen time before bed. However, sleep plays a vital role in both mental and physical development. Experts recommend that teens get at least 8 to 10 hours of sleep each night, yet many are getting far less.

A lack of sleep can lead to problems with concentration, mood, and academic performance. Long-term sleep deprivation is also linked to more serious health issues, such as obesity, depression, and a weakened immune system. Developing good sleep habits—like keeping a regular bedtime and avoiding screens late at night—can significantly improve overall well-being.
simplified:
Many teenagers don’t sleep enough. They are busy with school, friends, and using phones at night. But sleep is very important for the body and mind. Doctors say teenagers should sleep for 8 to 10 hours, but many do not.

If teenagers don’t sleep well, they may feel tired and sad. They may not do well in school. If this continues, it can cause health problems like getting sick more easily. It’s a good idea to sleep at the same time every night and not look at phones before bed.

questions.question: What is the main idea of this passage?
options: Teenagers need more free time
Phones are bad for your eyes
Not enough sleep can cause problems
Teens should eat better
questions.answer: Not enough sleep can cause problems
questions.hint: 第一パラグラフの全体の意味を読み取ろう。子供はもっと『　　』すべき？

questions.question: What does the word "deprived" most likely mean in the sentence: 'Teenagers today are often sleep-deprived due to busy school schedules...'
options: full of
lacking or missing
excited
worried
questions.hint: この言葉は良い意味？悪い意味？眠れていないということは…？

questions.question: According to the passage, what are possible long-term effects of not sleeping enough?
options: Improved energy and mood
Lower risk of disease
Obesity and a weak immune system
Better memory and stronger muscles
questions.answer: Obesity and a weak immune system
questions.hint: 第二パラグラフのリストに注目しよう。

questions.question: What does this sentence mean? 'Developing good sleep habits—like keeping a regular bedtime and avoiding screens late at night—can significantly improve overall well-being.'
options: Teenagers should stop sleeping to use their phones
Being healthy has nothing to do with sleep
Regular habits like sleep and avoiding screens help people stay healthy
Teens only need to eat well, not sleep well
questions.answer: Regular habits like sleep and avoiding screens help people stay healthy
questions.hint: この文の例（就寝時間やスマホ）から意味を考えてみよう。

questions.question: True or False: Doctors say teens should sleep at least 6 hours each night.
questions.hint: 第一パラグラフにある数字を見てみよう。

title: The Role of Music in Our Lives
original:
Music is an important part of every culture. It brings people together and expresses emotions. People listen to music when they are happy, sad, or need motivation.

In many countries, traditional music is played at festivals and ceremonies. Modern music connects global audiences. Whether it's classical, pop, or hip-hop, music helps people feel understood and inspired.
simplified:
Music is important in all cultures. It helps people share feelings. People listen to music when they are happy, sad, or need energy.

In many places, people play traditional music at festivals. New music styles are popular around the world. Music makes people feel good and connected.

questions.question: What is the main idea of this passage?
options: Music makes people hungry.
Music is only for young people.
Music connects people and expresses feelings.
Music is only traditional.
questions.answer: Music connects people and expresses feelings.
questions.hint: 第一パラグラフの意味を考えよう。なぜ人は音楽を聞く？

questions.question: What does 'motivation' most likely mean?
options: A type of music
Feeling tired
A reason to act or try
A festival name
questions.answer: A reason to act or try
questions.hint: 音楽を聞いて元気が出るということは…？

questions.question: According to the passage, how is traditional music used?
options: To connect with global audiences
At festivals and ceremonies
Only in schools
To make people sleepy
questions.hint: 第二パラグラフを読んでみよう。

questions.question: What does this sentence mean? 'Whether it's classical, pop, or hip-hop, music helps people feel understood and inspired.'
options: Only classical music is emotional
All music helps people feel something
Pop music is better than hip-hop
Music is confusing
questions.answer: All music helps people feel something
questions.hint: クラシックでもヒップホップでも…どうなる？

questions.question: True or False: Music is not important in ceremonies.
options: True
False
questions.hint: traditional music の使い方を見てみよう。

title: Knowing People in the Digital Age
original:
In the past, getting to know someone meant spending time together in person. We saw each other’s faces, heard each other’s voices, and shared real-life experiences. We learned about each other by talking, listening, and observing how people behaved in different situations.

Today, many of our relationships start online. We read messages, see pictures, and follow people on social media. But we often don’t meet them in real life. We don’t know their faces, their voices, or even if they are real. Knowing someone now is different—it can feel close but also far away at the same time.
simplified:
In the past, we got to know people by meeting them in person. We saw their faces, heard their voices, and spent time together. We learned about them by watching how they acted.

Today, we often meet people online. We see their messages and pictures but not their real faces or voices. Sometimes we don’t even know if they are real. Knowing someone is different now. It feels close, but also far.

glossary.definition: happening in the real world, not online
websites and apps used to share information and connect with others
to subscribe to someone's updates online

questions.question: What is the main idea of the passage?
options: It is harder to truly know someone in the digital age.
People are more honest online than in real life.
Technology makes relationships stronger.
The author believes the past was better than the present.
questions.hint: Compare how we knew people in the past and how we know them now.

questions.question: What does 'real-life experiences' mean?
options: Things that happen in dreams
Things that happen on the internet
Things that happen in the real world
Things that we see in movies
questions.hint: Think about where these experiences happen—online or not?

questions.question: What does “We don’t know their faces, their voices, or even if they are real.” mean?
options: We don't like talking to people online.
We know too much about people on the internet.
We often don’t know what people look or sound like online.
Everyone online uses fake names and voices.
questions.hint: Think about what we miss when we don’t meet people in person.

questions.question: The author believes that it is impossible to really know anyone online.
options: True
False
questions.hint: The author talks about how different it is, but doesn’t say it’s impossible.

questions.question: According to the passage, how has our way of knowing others changed over time?
options: We used to know people in person, but now we often connect without seeing or hearing them.
In the past, people didn’t talk much, but now we meet in real life more.
People used to trust strangers online, but now they never do.
We used to only know family, but now we know everyone.
questions.hint: Compare the two paragraphs. One describes the past, and one describes today.
